entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 3 (SNES, 1993) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 3 (SNES, 1993) (3)20131204
I played today for about two hours and beat all of World 8. I
skipped 8-1 after a lot of attempts and then had a struggle on
Castle Koopa. Eventually I thought it would be funny to see if a
P-Wing would be helpful, since I had banked so many of them. It
was super easy with a P-Wing. It didn't help much with Bowser,
because you have to touch the pit for him to go at you, but I
still beat him. Boom.

Total time: 6:11
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 3
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Movie: Days of Thunder, starring Tom Cruise (1990)
entry.content:
Movie: Days of Thunder, starring Tom Cruise (1990)20131202
This was a fun and heart-warming early 90s movie. Tom Cruise was in
good shape. I remember seeing this movie when I was younger, but
not well enough to have realized that Ricky Bobby was mainly a
parody of this movie.

entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (JP) (SNES, 1993) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (JP) (SNES, 1993) (3)20131201
This morning I played up to 7-4 in about an hour. All the World 7
levels were really tough. It was the worst on 7-1 and 7-2 because
I died within view of the flagpole and had to work my way back
painfully. 7-3 was a crazy level with the trampolines.

Total time: 4:29
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (JP)
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (US) (SNES, 1993) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (US) (SNES, 1993) (2)20131201
I played this for about forty minutes and did World 1. This is
great game. I'm going round and around the All-Stars collection.

--

Later in the day I played for another hour and did World 2. I died
3-1 and 3-2 but then died and decided to switch games. Something
I'm noticing a lot is that the characters have much larger hit
boxes than you'd expect them to and I keep getting hit by
surprise.

Total time: 1:39
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (US)
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 3 (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 3 (SNES, 1993)20131201
I played for about thirty minutes and got passed the World 2
Fortress. This game is great too. It's a bit odd how the
characters are slightly different proportions. The physics seem a
tiny bit different than the other games too.

--

I played for another two and half hours and got up to after the
first Fortress of World 6. This game is so good. I feel kind of
bad though that there's no incentive to do every level and, in
fact, because I'm so worried about conserving lives, I purposely
try to avoid doing more levels than necessary. For instance, I
didn't do 5-3 this time and get the Shoe. Anyways... what a great
game! I haven't used any hammers yet and need to remember to spend
them.

Total time: 3:05
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 3
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (JP) (SNES, 1993) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (JP) (SNES, 1993) (2)20131130
I played from 2-2 to 5-4 in about two hours today. This game is so
rad. The flow is amazing. I did 4-3 on my second try in continuous
run. 5-1 had a really good flow, but was pretty tough. 5-3 was
really hard, but I was able to continuously run through the
beginning part. It was so sweet.

--

Later in the day I played for another forty minutes. I beat 5-4,
which had some great flow. 6-1, which had a really cool beginning
with the three turtles that you can use to whack the Hammer
turtle. I messed up quite a bit at the water pool though. I did
6-2 really quickly, despite being a painful water level.

I really like playing through all the levels as small Mario
because it makes it so much more tense to not be allowed a single
hit. But also, power-ups are really scarce in this game, so it's
kind of necessary.

Total time: 3:21
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (JP)
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Movie: The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones, starring Lily Collins (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones, starring Lily Collins (2013)20131130
This is yet another movie trying to be the heir of Harry
Potter. This one is distinguished by being focused on a young
woman---in a way reminiscent of Twilight. Furthermore, it starts
with the grittiness and violence that Harry Potter ended with. The
movie has a lot of plot in it... I felt like there were many
opportunities for it to be finished with exposition and just move
on, but it didn't. Despite all this plot, there were some weird
unexplained things: like why did Bane show up in the Institute?
What happen to Simon being a vampire? There were a lot of hokey
moments---like the rain during the kiss. But overall, it was pretty
enjoyable.

I really disliked the moment of ironic sexism when Clary says, "Why
will it help my mom if I dress like a hooker?" We're supposed to
say, "Isn't she smart for saying that?" But the movie still puts
her on display and doesn't react to her, except for the guy (who
turns out to be her brother) who says, "Actually you look great",
which causes Clary to blush. Thus, we learn that boys like you when
you dress like a hooker. Great.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Illusion of Gaia (SNES, 1993) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Illusion of Gaia (SNES, 1993) (5)20131129
I finished the game today. It was so much fun and I'm so impressed
by the little things about the game. The music and graphics are
great. The gameplay is really good. The story and moments are
cute.

I found the Mt. Temple map very confusing. It was very endearing
and touching how Hamlet sacrificed himself and then talking to the
tribe afterwards was cool.

I love that you get Shadow. He's so rad, but he doesn't totally
break the game. The Mummy Queen especially is really hard. She was
much harder than the final boss for me. I died like 8 times on the
second round with her. The second round with the Vampires was hard
too.

I was so annoyed at how slow the text moved at the end of the
game. Blah.

Total time: 12:16
  • Video Games
  • Illusion of Gaia
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Illusion of Gaia (SNES, 1993) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Illusion of Gaia (SNES, 1993) (4)20131128
I played for about an hour and finished the Great Wall and went
to the next. The story in this is so sweet, but in a very
believable way. I especially like how often Will narrates what is
happening, but he does it from the perspective of the distance
future. It's so cool.

Total time: 7:29

  • SNES
